docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans in Congress sought to showcase what they call major security problems with the Obamacare website HealthCare.gov on Thursday, just as U.S. officials ramp up a national campaign to persuade young adults to use the site to enroll in health insurance.

headline.main: Republicans Warn of Security Flaws in Obamacare Website
headline.print_headline: Republicans Warn of Security Flaws in Obamacare Website

docs.snippet: Republicans in Congress sought to showcase what they call major security problems with the Obamacare website HealthCare.gov on Thursday, just as U.S. officials ramp up a national campaign to persuade young adults to use the site to enroll in health...

docs.lead_paragraph: A group of cyber security professionals is warning that the U.S. government has failed to implement fixes to protect the HealthCare.gov website from hackers, some three months after experts first pointed out the problem.

headline.main: Exclusive: U.S. Government Failed to Secure Obamacare Site-Experts
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: U.S. Government Failed to Secure Obamacare Site-Experts

docs.snippet: A group of cyber security professionals is warning that the U.S. government has failed to implement fixes to protect the HealthCare.gov website from hackers, some three months after experts first pointed out the problem.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health exchanges created under the Affordable Care Act have given public health systems an opportunity to attract more upscale patients.

headline.main: Public Hospitals Hope to Attract More Upscale Patients Under Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: Public Hospitals Use New Law to Expand Base Beyond Poor

docs.abstract: MetroPlus, health insurance plan of New York City’s public hospital system that has so far enrolled 22,000 people, hopes to reach 40,000 by end of 2014 and attract more affluent patients; network built to serve needy, under Affordable Care Act, sees potential source of additional revenue.
docs.snippet: The health exchanges created under the Affordable Care Act have given public health systems an opportunity to attract more upscale patients.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge’s ruling means that millions will be able to obtain health insurance subsidies, whether they buy coverage through the federal insurance exchange or one of the marketplaces run by the states.

headline.main: Federal Judge Upholds Health Care Subsidies
headline.print_headline: Federal Judge Upholds Health Care Subsidies

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Paul L Friedman rejects legal challenge to a central part of health care reform law; rules that millions of low- and moderate-income people could obtain health insurance subsidies regardless of whether they bought coverage through the federal insurance exchange or in the marketplaces run by the states; critics of law had said literal reading of it would allow subsidies in only 14 states, argument Friedman rejects.
docs.snippet: A judge’s ruling means that millions will be able to obtain health insurance subsidies, whether they buy coverage through the federal insurance exchange or one of the marketplaces run by the states.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Making good on a pledge from last year, the president announced the establishment of an institute in North Carolina that he said would reinvigorate the nation’s manufacturing economy.

headline.main: Obama Announces Institute to Create Manufacturing Jobs
headline.print_headline: Obama Announces Institute to Create Manufacturing Jobs

docs.snippet: Making good on a pledge from last year, the president announced the establishment of an institute in North Carolina that he said would reinvigorate the nation’s manufacturing economy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The late-December surge that pushed enrollment in private health insurance plans under Obamacare past 2.1 million people continued into 2014, officials of several state-run insurance marketplaces said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Obamacare 'Surge' Persists Into 2014 in Some States
headline.print_headline: Obamacare 'Surge' Persists Into 2014 in Some States

docs.snippet: The late-December surge that pushed enrollment in private health insurance plans under Obamacare past 2.1 million people continued into 2014, officials of several state-run insurance marketplaces said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has dismissed a challenge to part of the new health care law, ruling that the IRS may provide tax credits to residents of states that have declined to establish their own health insurance exchanges.

headline.main: Judge Dismisses Challenge to Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Judge Dismisses Challenge to Health Care Law

docs.snippet: A federal judge has dismissed a challenge to part of the new health care law, ruling that the IRS may provide tax credits to residents of states that have declined to establish their own health insurance exchanges.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved a $1.1 trillion spending bill on Wednesday that quashes the threat of a government shutdown through September 30 and offers lawmakers a chance to end four years of chaotic, crisis-driven budgeting.

headline.main: House Approves $1.1 Trillion Measure to Fund Government Through Sept 30
headline.print_headline: House Approves $1.1 Trillion Measure to Fund Government Through Sept 30

docs.snippet: The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved a $1.1 trillion spending bill on Wednesday that quashes the threat of a government shutdown through September 30 and offers lawmakers a chance to end four years of chaotic, crisis-driven...

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Wednesday upheld the health insurance subsidies that are available in the 34 U.S. states that declined to establish their own online marketplaces, rejecting a lawsuit that said the subsidies were unlawful.

headline.main: U.S. Judge Rejects Challenge to 'Obamacare' Insurance Subsidies
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Rejects Challenge to 'Obamacare' Insurance Subsidies

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Wednesday upheld the health insurance subsidies that are available in the 34 U.S. states that declined to establish their own online marketplaces, rejecting a lawsuit that said the subsidies were unlawful.

docs.lead_paragraph: A $1.1 trillion spending bill for operating the government until just before next fall's election steamed through the battle-weary House on Wednesday over tepid protests from tea party conservatives, driven by a bipartisan desire to restore painful cuts in domestic and defense programs and show disaffected voters that Congress can do its job.

headline.main: House Passes $1.1 Trillion Bill to Fund Government
